subject: Data
title: Surveillance and Big Data: Watching Everyone at Once
description: A short lesson to help you apply Surveillance and Big Data: Watching Everyone at Once.

hook.text: China's social credit system tracks 1.4 billion citizens using cameras, purchases, and online activity.

buildup.text: Governments and corporations combine big data streams to monitor populations at unprecedented scale.

discovery.text: Mass surveillance needs big data tools â€” facial recognition, location tracking, and network analysis.

twist.text: Democracies use the same tools. NSA's PRISM collected data from millions of Americans' communications.

climax.text: The line between security and surveillance depends on who controls the data and how it's governed.

punchline.text: Big data sees everything. The question is who gets to look.

quiz.question: What enables modern mass surveillance?
options: Big data tools like facial recognition and network analysis
